alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 11:56PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma County through 1230 AM MDT... At 1156 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Eckley, or 17 miles northeast of Yuma, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma County, including the following locations... Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 252 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
